title: 113_s433
content: The Act titled the "Center to Advance, Monitor, and Preserve University Security Safety Act of 2013" or the "CAMPUS Safety Act of 2013" establishes a National Center for Campus Public Safety. The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to include making subawards to institutions of higher education and nonprofit organizations to assist the National Center for Campus Public Safety. The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to allow institutions of higher education and nonprofit organizations to receive subawards for assisting the National Center for Campus Public Safety. The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to allow institutions of higher education and nonprofit organizations to receive subawards for assisting the National Center for Campus Public Safety. SEC. 509 establishes the National Center for Campus Public Safety. The Attorney General may establish and operate a National Center for Campus Public Safety to provide education, training, research, and information dissemination for institutions of higher education and their partners. The National Center for Campus Public Safety coordinates with various stakeholders to develop protocols and best practices for campus safety, including prevention of violence and emergency response procedures. It also promotes effective behavioral threat assessment models to prevent campus violence. The curr_chunk focuses on promoting cooperation and collaboration among public safety personnel in higher education institutions to prevent campus violence. It also aims to disseminate standardized formats and models for campus safety information and resources. The curr_chunk focuses on establishing a Center to promote cooperation among campus security agencies and public safety organizations. It includes disseminating standardized formats for mutual aid agreements and reporting activities to Congress annually. Coordination with relevant agencies and resources is emphasized, including the Department of Homeland Security, Department of Education, and State officials. The curr_chunk emphasizes the need for coordination within the Department of Justice and existing grant programs to prevent duplication. The Attorney General is required to issue a report at the end of each fiscal year assessing the impacts and effectiveness of grants distributed, identifying any duplicative activities, and making the report available to relevant committees. The Act allows public schools to benefit from the National Center for Campus Public Safety without precluding them from receiving information and training.
